[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Struct: SubTranscript] [Vector sizes] Can Vs, Cs, and Rs vectors have mismatched sizes that break verification invariants but still deserialize successfully? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: get_public_key_share()] [Index bounds] Can player.id exceed the bounds of Vs vector, causing panic or returning wrong public key shares? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: get_dealt_public_key()] [Empty vector] What happens if Vs is empty when calling .last().expect(), can this panic in production and halt DKG? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Function: maul_signature()] [Malleability] The function panics for chunky PVSS - is this safe, or should it return an error to prevent DoS attacks during transcript manipulation attempts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Constant: DST] [Domain separation] Is the 32-byte DST 'APTOS_CHUNK_EG_FIELD_PVSS_FS_DST' unique enough to prevent cross-protocol attacks with other Aptos cryptographic schemes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Randomness balance] Does the correlated randomness generation properly set r_0 as the negative sum of other r_i values to maintain zero sum, or can rounding errors break correlation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Base overflow] When computing cur_base *= radix_f repeatedly, can this overflow for large num_chunks causing incorrect randomness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: correlated_randomness()] [Zero randomness] If all random r values happen to be zero, does this compromise the semantic security of the ElGamal encryption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: num_chunks_per_scalar()] [Integer overflow] Can div_ceil with very large ell values cause integer overflow when computing number of chunks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Generator collision] Are G and H guaranteed to be independent generators, or can they be equal leading to broken encryption scheme? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: default()] [Weak hashing] Does unsafe_hash_to_affine provide strong enough guarantees that G and H are random and independent? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Struct: Homomorphism] [Apply soundness] In computing C_i,j = z_i,j * G + r_j * ek_i, can ek_i being point at infinity break encryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: msm_terms()] [Bounds checking] When zipping z_i and plaintext_randomness, can mismatched vector lengths cause incorrect ciphertext generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Function: msm_eval()] [MSM failure] What happens if E::G1::msm() returns an error - does it panic or return corrupted ciphertext? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Struct: CodomainShape] [Deserialization] Can a malicious actor provide CodomainShape with mismatched chunks and randomness vector lengths to break verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [Trait: EntrywiseMap] [Type safety] Does the map function properly preserve cryptographic structure when converting between types? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: scalar_to_le_chunks()] [Chunk size validation] Does the assertion that num_bits is multiple of 8 and <= 64 prevent all invalid chunk sizes, or can edge cases slip through? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: scalar_to_le_chunks()] [Byte overflow] When converting bytes_chunk to u64, can values exceed 2^num_bits causing chunks to be out of range? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: scalar_to_le_chunks()] [Padding vulnerability] Does the padded buffer properly zero-initialize, or can uninitialized memory leak into chunks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: scalar_to_le_chunks()] [Last chunk] Is the last chunk properly handled when bytes.len() is not divisible by num_bytes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: le_chunks_to_scalar()] [Reconstruction overflow] When computing acc += chunk * multiplier, can integer overflow occur for large chunk counts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: le_chunks_to_scalar()] [Base computation] Does F::from(1u128 << num_bits) correctly handle num_bits = 64, or does bit shift overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: le_chunks_to_scalar()] [Multiplier overflow] Can multiplier *= base cause overflow after many iterations, breaking reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunks] [Function: le_chunks_to_scalar()] [Chunk validity] Does the function verify that each chunk is < 2^num_bits, or can invalid chunks cause incorrect reconstruction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: hkzg_chunked_elgamal] [Struct: HkzgElgamalWitness] [Witness consistency] Can the three witness components (hkzg_randomness, chunked_plaintexts, elgamal_randomness) be inconsistent with each other but still pass verification?
